reviews.text: Absolutely lovely place to grab food and drinks. The library is a semi private space to enjoy your meal and relax. Went with my little sister after her grad and we enjoyed tapas, drinks, dinner, and watched some MTV classics 😂. Our bartend ladies were amazing 😍

This is the best hotel in DC!  impeccable service and such an amazing professional staff! Thank you,Jefferson team for setting such a high standard of excellence!  All of the touches you implement are noticed and appreciated.  Our entire family loves this hotel and has many fond memories here throughout many decades now!

I had a gift card and decided to use it to take a friend to lunch.  I had checked the balance about a week ahead.  After ordering, I had the waitress check it again, and was told it was no longer good.  Embarrassing!
David Bueno, General Manager, "saved the day".  He honored the gift card.  We will definitely return.

TOP TIER.
Exemplary service.
I took one of my students to experience the Jefferson level of service so that she may understand what and how to deliver similar experiences when interacting with her own clientele.

In a world of quick service, I'm so glad to see the attention to detail remains at Jefferson.
Best bar in DC. Quiet, professional, romantic. Amazing martinis and ask for the pickled vegetables that come on the side. So glad this place exists. You won’t be disappointed

Headed to Old Ebbitt during the spring for the second time in my life and boy was excited to be back. Sat at the bar this time for a late lunch and some drinks. Bartender was super friendly to us as tourists, helpful with the drink and food menu suggestions, and very attentive. Made everyone at the bar feel like regulars striking up conversations with everyone.

The drinks were well made and the food was delicious. The overall atmosphere makes you think of all the people who have visited the bar since its existence. Really close to several attractions and easy to walk or bike to.  I look forward to visiting for dinner next time I’m in town.

There are straightforward American-style food. This restaurant is best known for its huge old-school oyster bar—think lots of dark wood, brass fixtures, and big mirrors. That oysters was fantastic and fresh.  We’ve  enjoyed also cheese sampler, fried calamari and baked oysters. Everything they do is absolutely delicious. The service was very fast and friendly. We were happy to choose this great restaurant to end our busy day in Washington, D.C.

Loved the experience! Tasted a dozen oysters and each one was more delicious than the other.
Wine is very fairly priced. Saw it more expensive in some New York wine discount stores.
The fish was such a huge portion when they split it in two plates we told them that we did not order 2 plates but to our surprise that was a full plate.
If you get a chance to go to happy hours for oysters don't hesitate!

Make Reservation!
This place is a must when in DC.
Freshest seafood , the flavors are so delightful. The preparation is pretty quick, fresh and delicious. The plate sizes are very filling. Service is unexpectedly good , considering how busy and packed the place is.
Check out the happy hours - particularly for the deal on oysters.

So glad we got desserts even though we were so stuffed with the main course alone.

Had an awesome time here as a late night/ early next day stop. The food was quite nice and fairly refined, especially at such a late hour! The atmosphere was popping as well which made it more enjoyable. Service was very friendly and they had great oysters. Fresh complimentary bread never hurts either…

Decided to come here for my birthday. Was super excited based on the reviews. Honestly,  all I can say is that it was okay. The atmosphere is absolutely stunning. The private dining option is amazing.  I wasn't pleased with the hostesses, which honestly drives my overall rating. Our server, while nice, just lacked something for me. The food was okay, nothing to scream about. I did enjoy the sushi roll I got, and my daughter enjoyed her lobster roll with a gluten-free free bread option, which was nice. I asked our server about validating our parking ticket, and she said the hostess could do that. When I got to the hostess stand, the girl rudely said they don't validate that parking garage ticket. I just felt after leaving, there was nothing all that special.

One of the best steaks I've had for a very long time. Very prompt seating even when busy. Very quick and polite service and delicious drinks. Even with special requests, they were very accommodating. Loved the inside design and lighting as every area was unique and colorful with the perfect amount of lighting. Can't wait to go back.

Hamilton, a restaurant located in Washington D.C., is a fantastic dining experience for anyone looking for delicious food and a great atmosphere. The restaurant is named after Alexander Hamilton, one of the founding fathers of the United States, and the decor reflects this theme with portraits of historical figures and vintage maps on the walls.

The menu at Hamilton offers a diverse range of dishes that are sure to please any palate. The seafood is particularly notable, with dishes like the crab cakes and seared scallops being favorites among diners. Additionally, the restaurant offers a selection of meat dishes such as the dry-aged steak and the lamb chops. The menu changes seasonally, so it's always a great idea to check the menu before going.

The service at Hamilton is top-notch, with the waitstaff being friendly and attentive. They are knowledgeable about the menu and can make great recommendations for diners who may be unsure of what to order.

The restaurant also has a great wine list, with a variety of options to complement the food. And they also offer a great selection of cocktails and beers.

One thing to keep in mind is that Hamilton can be a bit pricey, so it's best to save it for a special occasion. And also, it's a popular spot, so it's always a good idea to make a reservation in advance.

Overall, Hamilton is a fantastic restaurant that offers delicious food, great service, and a great atmosphere. It's a perfect spot for a special occasion, a date night, or a casual dinner with friends and family.

We made reservations at 6pm and were sat down right away upon arrival. Food was delicious and all came out quick! The Mac and cheese was a little cold but other than that, all of the dishes were 5/5.  On top of the fast service, our server Courtney was super nice and knowledgeable of everything on the menu. Loved our server and the food! Highly recommend as a dinner spot for friends and family!

We celebrated my bday here last night and it felt like we were dinning in back in time. The decor was very dramatic and vibe was a mix of chill and a good time. Performances are available in the basement( tickets sold separately) if you prefer to dine in with live music. If not, the dinning room upstairs is for you. The establishment is clean, the staff were welcoming and even though it was a bit busy, our food still came out in a timely manner. Food was tasty and we really enjoyed our time. They do have sushi happy hour from 2-5 Monday to Friday. I’m going to try that next! Also list of shows are also available on the left side of the menu.

Had an excellent experience at Zaytinya by Jose Andres. The food was very tasteful and unique. The cocktails were delicious and so was the wine. The menu was expansive so our large group decided on a tasting menu and it was awesome. The tasting menu was vast for the price, we got to try a little big of everything and it all tasted great. Service was slow at the beginning but after we got our first round of drinks the attention to detail picked up. I would normally comment on the dishes I really enjoy but I tried so many things it would be hard to choose. Definitely a spot to check out for some Mediterranean cuisine and I highly recommend it.

Wow! 🎶
Everything was fantastic. I can’t remember the last time I enjoyed such a wonderful meal.
We had a reservation for an afternoon lunch. Upon arrival, we were greeted and seated immediately.  The wait staff was courteous and efficient.  We let our daughter, Julia, order for our table; everything she suggested was delicious and cooked to perfection. The pacing of the dishes was nice as well; a few dishes were brought out at a time.  We weren’t rushed and plates were cleared away between courses. We were there just over an hour and even had dessert.
I can’t wait to go again. ✨

I get the hype! The chef’s tasting menu ($70 PP) was delish and very filling. The appetizers were all top notch. The hummus was especially smooth (I don’t think I’ve had any hummus has smooth as this before). The beef strips resembled cured meat and was also delicious when paired with the grapes and pine nuts. Feta salad with mandarin slices and beets was also very good. We requested for the octopus to be included and it was hands down the best cooked octopus I’ve eaten. It’s not rubbery at all and has a perfect char on it. Of all the things we got, the only dish I would not eat again are the zucchini Patties. They had an odd flavor to them that reminded me of how ammonia or sulfur smells.

The two desserts were a molten coffee cake and apricot green yogurt. The top of the apricot dessert was extremely tart but you can take off the sorbet if you don’t like tart items. The lava cake was slightly molten in the center but had excellent flavor — slightly bitter, deep coffee depth, but not too sweet.

Had an amazing time at Zaytinya. The service was great, the food was amazing and the ambiance was very intimate. Came here for an anniversary and it was top of the line. From service, to food and ambiance. Highly recommend to everyone. We tried the chef tasting and it was incredible. An abundance of food. I was super full at the end. A great way to try mostly everything on the menu if you are not sure what to order.  Also I was not a big fan of lamb. But the way the lamb shank was made, definitely made me rethink all of that. It was so delicious and there was no aftertaste to it. Super delicious, tasted just like a steak!

5 stars across the board. This is hands down some of the best Mediterranean food I’ve had in the area. I came here for DC restaurant week and was blown away. The decor, food, and service were all phenomenal. I usually don’t particularly love dining during restaurant week because it’s generally not a great value, the portions are small and the quality standard usually is lesser. However, that was not the case here. The restaurant week menu was a great value and had sufficient portions. We ordered a few additional small plates, out of curiosity but it wasn’t a necessity. The food was all very tasty, as well as the cocktail on special. Service was great from the hostesses to the server and bussers. Everyone was very pleasant and professional. I definitely intend on coming back.

After visiting DC’s Christian market, we were tired and hungry. We really enjoyed our dinner and the customer service. The venue was was and clean. We were seated right away and someone immediately came to our table and gave us water and then a few minutes later our waiter stopped by the table. Our reservation was at 6:45pm and they were definitely busy. However, we were served our food in a timely manner. Our food was delicious and the drinks were made perfect-at least for my liking. I will definitely will come back here again and I do recommend this place. Parking is also available in the same block d as the restaurant.

As a party of three, we started with the cheese puffs and these were excellent - very rich though. To start I had the lyonnaise salad and this was incredible-  we have been to Lyon and this was just as delicious as there signature dish. We also had a lobster bisque special which was the best ever tasted and we have eaten a lot of them around the world. For main we all had chicken dishes and they were excellent, although the chicken schnitzel is huge-bigger than our head . Desserts were excellent too, pictures to follow :

I’ve been here a few times for dinner and this was my first time for lunch.  The service is always perfect.

The French onion soup is delicious and the burger was as expected for lunch.  The sauce on the top bun was tasty too.

The chicken nugget appetizer was tough and not good texture and mouth feel wise, but the sauce was nice.

Each dinner has been as expected.  If you want consistency with French food and amazing customer service, Central is for you.

Excellent food. Friendly, professional service. We had onion soup, shrimp burger, tagine, branzino, fish and chips and tried the majority of the desserts, as well as some of the beverage list.
It's somewhat hard to hear for conversation, acoustics are a bit rough.
Lovely place and we'll definitely be back.

I was overwhelmed! First time in DC, my first meal here…. I felt so lucky!! Found you!!!
Awesome services 😍warmly! Delicious food! Un-expected price!( Thought more expensive in this area and with this good quality service and fancy restaurant)
We have 3 adults and 2 kids. Boys looooove spaghetti and Mac and cheese!!! Me222! Believe me! They are not like regular spaghetti and Mac and cheese!! If you have kids! 💯 try it!!!

We tried the set menu and so worth it. The food is great, and the chefs present Indian food with a modern take but still keep the amazing authentic flavors in the dishes. But the service is hands down the best in town. The staff are very professional, friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming, especially Gustavo who we had a pleasure to met with during our first dinner experience in Rasika a couple of days ago. It’s always a bit competitive to get a table there but a must go to restaurant in DC, especially if you love food with a lot of flavors

LOVE this place! The food is great, the staff is great, ambiance is great. The dishes are a modern twist in terms of flavors, textures and appearance. Yet still heavily connected to the inspiration, so you will know what you are eating. Our favorite was the palak (spinach) dish. Could not take a photo as we were hungry and just dug into the food. The Naan (bread) was like a buttery cloud you would want to sleep on. If you dine-in, you can get multiple small portions of the entree to try out different menu options, which is what we did. We loved the food so much that we ate here 4 times out of our 3 day stay in the area!

Excellent Indian restaurant. Whenever I come to Washington DC, Rasika is on my stop list. Last 5 years, I have not had any bad dishes. You can order anything from the menu and it will taste delicious.

I have been wanting to visit here for several years. I wanted to get the tasting menu, but I went with someone who is non veg, so I tried 4 vegetable side curries and the bread basket instead. Asparagus was very good. Eggplant was tasty, but a bit too spicy for my liking. Malai kofta had delicious dumplings, but the sauce was bitter. Zucchini fritters were very dry, but the curry was excellent. I ended up eating just the sauce with the bread. Breads were all great. Service was fantastic. Loved the inside ambiance, the patio space, and the silverware.

The best Indian food I have ever had, do not forget to order/specially go there for the Gujarati lasagne (it literally blew my mind by how balanced and wholesome it was!). Their purple potato dosa was a family favorite. The staff was very sweet and loving and the service was fast and great.

An amazing foodie experience. The personal experience from ALL the staff from the moment we walked in made for the start of an truly special anniversary dinning experience. Well worth the $$$. Jackets are not required for gentlemen, but I was also one of the very few without. The food was delicious and the photos don’t do them Justice. The neighboring tables were engaging and open for menu suggestions back and forth. And I think we saw a notable or too if your into the DC scene.

Phenomenal experience!
I celebrated my 5 year anniversary at Tosca, and they really made us feel special. The scallops, tenderloin, and veal were flavorful. Service was amazing, and we were seated in a beautiful area. I will definitely return!

This is an outstanding restaurant within the heart of Washington DC.
The venue was renovated during the pandemic, has a brand new interior with nice noise dampening ceiling panels which certainly keep the ambiance. Service is exceptional with knowledgeable waiting staff.
The food is Italian inspired modern dishes including refined selection of pastas, octopus with apple puree, perfectly prepared beef tenderloin, squid ink infused risotto with grilled calamari etc. Their wine list is dominated by an Italian selection complimented with Californian wines. From their deserts, the panna cotta is exceptional.
Not cheap, but for this experience, it is worth it.

10/10

Service is solid, the waiters are very attentive and want to make sure you're always content.

The dry-aged ribeye was delicious, the sauce was full of flavor. I wish it would have had more of the potato puree to add to the steak, but overall really enjoyed my dish.

Inside decor is very pretty.

Great location!

Tosca Is a lovely place for an upscale unfussy lunch downtown. Service is impeccable and food options are diverse and well prepared. Very easy to get in and out within an hour yet not fell rushed.  Go for the thoughtful appetiser menu, stay for the cocktails and delightful ambiance.

The service here is quick and friendly staff. Our host was excellent and give us some brief explanations and suggestions what to order. She did not rushed us when we order. Although it was a bit of wait to get a table for 6 person, it was worth the wait. Food were delicious and authentic Mexican. Prices are reasonable. Will come back here for our next DC visit.

Enjoyed dinner. Loved the fun energetic atmosphere. We made reservations here for dinner. Loved that the chips and salsa were complimentary and placed on our table when we sat down. The guacamole was really good. I had the enchiladas and my husband had a chicken taco and a beef taco. Everything was good. Service was great.

My family and I traveled from Atlanta and while walking around DC we came across this gem. Our server was Joanna and she was great at taking care of us and made us feel comfortable! Had knowledge on any questions we had, which was a plus! We were beyond pleased with the food, drinks, desserts and the pleasant atmosphere!!!
Definitely went above and beyond our expectations, with great authentic Mexican dishes. We couldn’t have been happier, we look forward to coming back in the future! Greatly recommend!!! It’s a must try.

The food is quite tasty. When we visited, though, the service was a bit uneven. The food seemed to rush out, but our server would disappear for long stretches. We highly recommend the guacamole. It was yummy, but we ordered it spicy and it came out mild. The chips and salsa were excellent.  We also had t cevice and Vera Cruz tuna tacos.  Both were great.

Definitely worth a visit. We had a great evening here. The server was kind and friendly. The food was amazing. They bring you warm chips and salsa, which are great. We tried two different margaritas. The Serrano Margarita was a spicy delicious kick in the face :) The Al Gusto was good as well. All 3 tacos were excellent. Really well done. And the place feels reasonably priced. The decor is super eclectic and fun as well, butterflies everywhere. We would highly recommend this place.

If I could give this place more stars, I would. The food was nothing short of excellent- top tier in every respect. It's pricey, but well worth it. The steak was a PERFECT medium rare all the way through. I've never seen one cooked that perfectly. The staff is also outstanding. They were very professional and fun too. I hope I'm not butchering the name spelling,  but Giovanni and Miner (if I heard that right- my hearing isn't great) were awesome.

I would recommend to anyone.

I was a member of a party of 5 for my friend's birthday. We were able to reserve a table in advance which was very convenient. Our server, José, was impeccably warm and attentive. The food was beautifully plated and delicious. I tried the chicken-fried lobster and would totally recommend. No part of our meal or experience was anything less than great. It's pricey, but I'd definitely dine here again.

Went here for dinner to celebrate my birthday with friends. They were really great at accomplishing a large group of 11. Service was a little bit slow, but that is okay since there was so many of us. Everyone really enjoyed their food and drinks. I ordered the king crab and creamed corn, both were very delicious. The sangrias were also a hit if you like sweet drinks. Just be aware that cake cutting is $5 PER SLICE. yikes. At least they gave me the slice with my name on it.

I visited Oceanaire this past week and had an awesome experience.  Firstly the waitstaff who seated us were polite and attentive. Seating was nice and the section was dimly lit which gave a comfy feel. Our
waiter Sam was awesome. He was personable and knowledgeable of the menu and wine list! He was professional yet very easy to talk to and his suggestions were spot on.  For my main course I ordered the double lobster tail and it was delish! Overall my experience was A1 and I would recommend Oceanaire to friends and family.

I wish I could give 4.5 stars. I love the Oceanaire! But this was not our best experience at one. Not bad at all but definitely, it was "pre valentine's day" mode and it was palpable in the service. Food - delicious, fresh, bright. So good! We had the crab soup (amazing), oreganata scallops (a bit too creamy), house cobb salad (basic, nothing special, but big portion), tuna tartar (my fave), calamari (big portion and delicious!!), and a raw oyster. Drinks are delicious too. Service - we had 3 or 4 waiters (I think most of them were being trained in preparation for vday weekend, which was the next day); nothing wrong with them but we felt like we were interupted every five minutes by each one checking on us. One waiter is enough, but too many meant too many checkins. I would definitely return for the food and ambience on a fancy night out, but I think I'll be more careful about the day and holidays I choose to eat around.

We love Hill Country and the food is consistently good each visit. One caveat for this visit though, I remember the Mac and cheese being a lot better than what it was this particular evening. It was still good but maybe it wasn’t as good as I remembered. There was a hockey game in the city tonight and this was a good treat before game time. The restaurant had good seating and the bar area had plenty of seats left. Overall I really enjoy the food and would go back for sure!

Get transported to a wild west canteen with good food. Yeah why, not. I'll take it. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. The canteen style actually works and is efficient, so you get the food from the counter and sit anywhere you like. The meat was good, roughly what I expected. So I can't complain. The price might be a bit high for what it is. I'm giving 5 stars because with the potential of live music, this place has potential and can be very lively.

Now this is BBQ!! I was a bit concerned when my pal said DC had good BBQ, but after this visit, I owed him a “you were right!” Big spaces, nice tables and a full bar. The food was just amazing. Friendly staff and we never went without our glasses full. Somehow I was able to eat a whole brisket sandwich, beans with burnt ends, and two cornbread muffins. This was the best food I had in DC the whole week.

Great Texas BBQ in the heart of DC.  The service here is topnotch.  We were greeted warmly and shown to a table right away.  We were also asked if we had dined at Hill Country before and when we said we had not, the hostess politely informed us of how the ordering process works, which was really helpful.  The staff preparing the meat were friendly and engaged us in conversation while they prepared our plates.  There are several types of meat to choose from....brisket, sausage, chicken, etc.  All were really good.  The chicken was more moist than almost any other bbq place I have visited in DC and Texas.  They have every side you can think of as well.  I highly recommend the bourbon mashed sweet potato, chili, and deviled eggs.  The cornbread is pretty good too....honey butter is delish.  They offer margarita pitchers, which are really good, just be sure to sit in the bar area if you want to take advantage of the happy hour specials.  They also have another large dance club space in the basement, where it looks like they have live bands.  Overall, we had a great time and would comeback.  Thanks!

First-time eating here and let me tell you it won't be the last. The food was amazing the brisket was moist, the chicken was good, and the ribs amazing. The side was good to the mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, and greens. Some of the best BBQ I had in a while.

DELICIOUS!! Glad I tried this place out. Must say, this is pretty good chicken that tastes freshly made. Mobile ordering at the table is available, or you could order at the counter. Menu has many options for you to pick from, from bowls to chicken breasts, even, sandwiches! Staff were friendly and accommodating. Just wish they had a bigger dessert menu. But, overall, I still plan to return. Must try!!

I have been wanting to try Nando’s for a very very long time. Finally!

We ordered the whole chicken and the wings. We also tried the custard tarts for dessert. I am not really a fan of the custard. They are ordinary for me. But the chicken and the sauces… those are a different story.

I can understand the craze and hype about Nando’s and how they franchised so quickly. I cannot even find the right words to describe it. The chicken is halal, I believe, which is why it’s also a hit for our Muslim brothers. The chicken is very tender and has the right amount of flavor that will complement any sauce you choose. From mild to extremely hot, you can dip or drown the chicken in any sauces and finish it to the bones.

Ordering and paying is through their website or app. Make sure you put your table number if you are dining in and they will serve your order in 10-20 minutes. You do not need to buzz your table after eating. The staff will do that for you. Hence, you need to tip. You have to get your own sauces, utensils, and fountain drink/water though.

I have tried their juice as well. I think I ordered something with a pineapple orange and it is very refreshing. Sweet but refreshing.

Credit cards accepted. For this location, and most establishments nearby (that I have noticed), there is security present.

Portuguese is on of my favorite cuisines, I was so happy to be in Washington D.C. and see a great chain of a Portuguese restaurant every where in D.C.
we ordered chicken, dessert and garlic bread. The chicken and the garlic bread were SO delicious. I hope they can open in NJ or in NY. Also the place was pleasant and they have a big area of different seating.

The chicken was so delicious with a variety of spice options; we chose lime and hot options. They have much indoor seating. For drinks option they have Portuguese beer and wine! As well as other non alcoholic beverages. They have pasteis de Nata. The staff is friendly. Also they are very clean and keep covid precaution practices. After each person leaves, I noticed they cleaned the table right away. They also have contactless food ordering by scanning the barcode and ordering online with payment. I really loved coming here and hope to return again in the future.

First time for Persian chicken and will definitely be back! The chicken bowl was delicious. The plentiful options for sauces made the experience so much fun. Love that they bring the food to you vs standing at counter waiting for your order. The only thing I would change is to have wait staff come to your table vs standing in line to order.

Had a wonderful Mother's Day dinner here. A party of 8, we were seated in the back by the kitchen. Ambiance was vibrant, music selection was great throughout the night and our server was very attentive.

Got the fried snapper fish, came with a full body fried fish! Skin was crispy and flavorful, and the meat was tender. Rice and side salad came with the dish, provided good balance. My partner tried the Carolina Gumbo, to her liking!

Will definitely return for date night or just a nice random dinner outing. Enjoy!

Food is delicious! I had the lamb chops. They had a lot of fat on them which I didn’t really like but it was seasoned well. I also had the fried green tomatoes, a wonderful appetizer if you’re vegan. The cornbread was also a hit! I took some to go 😊. The drinks were pricey but strong. The best thing was the service!! Friendly and helpful staff that always checked on our large party.

This may be one of the funnest times I've ever had dinning out while out of town! The restaurant is beautiful and they've done a great job of decorations. The menu is an interesting and varied offering based on Southern soul food and New Orleans cuisine. I was able to join a large group of people and the restaurant was able to accommodate us wonderfully. The live music was also fantastic. I highly recommend the chicken fried steak!

A Sunday Brunch & Exquisite!  Place was absolutely beautiful & chic! The courses for the meal was just divine! Reservations recommended! The hustle & bustle of the city matches our beauty inside of the Black Diaspora! The food , from beginning to end , was nothing short of AMAZING! LOVE !  Staff was attentive, warm & inviting ! The house band played... We did not want leave! Celebrate our soul food traditions with just a different depth! Grits, biscuits, salad & my fave... Fried green tomatoes! I highly recommend! Prepare for an experience!

A fun atmosphere but overall wasn't worth the cost. For $200, my partner and I split the fried green tomato appetizer, each had a main - devil's shrimp for me and fried snapper for him - and shared the pecan pie and peach cobbler. The food was fine, tasty but not the tastiest, unique, or elevated. And for $35-50 per main, I expected more.

The Sangria Hour is well worth it, as the cocktails and tapas are well priced. Tapas portions are large and shareable among friends that want to sample a few dishes. Classic flavours and quality you can count on. Dishes are not terribly creative, but the service is quick with minimalist communication.

My future wife and I went to Jaleo for restaurant week and also to meet with our potential wedding planner. I love the vibe of this restaurant and their staff. The sangria was awesome. My Fiancé enjoyed it. It was a 5 course meal with small tapas but at the end we were extremely full. Each persons meal was $40 during restaurant week. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. We went to this restaurant 3 years ago so it was nostalgic. The dessert was probably my favorite pan chocolate. The waiter did a great job.

This place is so good.  I have been to the one in Chicago for happy hour and was excited to get a reservation here for dinner.  We did the $80/pp tasting experience and it was so worth it.  I don't eat pork and the chef was able to customize for me.  We had amazing service and the food was so delicious.  I loved the tasting because it allowed us to try so many things.

Fantastic experience overall with excellent service. Our bartender/server gave us great suggestions and the drinks were fantastic as well.

We were happy with every dish we received with one exception (our salad had mealy apple bits in it that detracted from the experience) and the octopus was cooked perfectly. Will happily return in the future.

During a recent trip to DC, I ate a few Michelin starred restaurants. However, it was the atmosphere and flavors of Jaleo that I can’t forget.
While the service was a little cold and mechanical, the drinks and menu well made up for it.
I ordered a plate from each of their categories and was shocked at the hefty portion sizes. This is not your average tapas plate size.
My absolute favorites were the Iberico, potato salad with roe, and the endive orange bites.

Definitely order a sherry cocktail from the bar!

Julia, Julia, Julia our bartender was awesome. She was very knowledge of all their options and willingly took the time to assist with choices desired and uncertain of. She explained, in detail, the differences between various items on the menu so that we coukd make the best choice for us overall. May I say that the wings were delicious and still burning the corners of my mouth, lol. The fries were heavy and truly filled you up after a few. The Creme Brule was an awesome choice in doughnut that I appreciate her advising me of it and last but not least that chedder biscuit blew me out of this world. I did not have enough space in me to ingest it all but at least I can rock twice tomorrow. Thankibg Julia for her service. It was awesome and appre oates. A must go while here in DC.

Not worth it. I’ve been dying to come to try the chicken and was sorely disappointed. Waited 40 minutes for bland chicken and a soggy sandwich. Donuts were fine, but not as good as my first try here. Staff was rude. We got there when it was empty, left when it was full. Might be short staffed but doesn’t mean you need to audibly sigh when someone needs to order from you.
Good beer selection but they don't have the complete Atro Donut menu. But great place.

First time here, a bit disappointed. The beer selection was definitely below average for a beer hall. Not crowded, it was easy to find a table to hang out. The 90's alternative rock music was enjoyable - not sure if this music is part of the theme or not. Overall, my experience was just okay.

The service is so bad here, I am stopping in the middle of my meal to write this, so that I might be able to spare another innocent and unknowing soul from coming in here and choking on a cheddar biscuit and their disappointment.
Staff are as pleasant as a bed of nails; food took 45 minutes (for 1 entree, 2 apps and 2 sides) and was mediocre at best.
The bartender and food expeditor were so dismal, another patron actually stopped to ask me, if they were in fact as miserable as he thought. I agreed emphatically and showed him I was in the middle of writing this review.
Spare yourself, your family/friends and tastebuds; but if you don’t like someone, send them here, cause they just might fit right in.

name: Café du Parc
vicinity: at Willard InterContinental, 1401 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: Great experience. Good setting with good food. Service was good and we were able to enjoy our food. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the fries that went with them were also great. On top off that it was reasonably priced which was great. The sorbet portions were very generous indeed.

Cafe du Parc is in the Willard Hotel. First of all, the hotel and restaurant were breath-taking!  Everything was beautifully decorated for the holidays! We ordered a Cobb salad, Willard burger, and even a side of ratatouille, which was as delicious as the movie says! Service was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxing! Sorry, no food pics, but would highly recommend for a spectacular lunch!

The cutest little French pastry shop!  Delicious coffee!  Right next to the White House and across from the WWI memorial. After seeing all the memorials and important buildings this is the perfect spot to take a break and enjoy elegant desserts!
The peach pastry I ate was amazing and the coffee superb!

Was walking from downtown, to the monuments on a Saturday afternoon. No place was open for coffee, but we came across this boujie little spot.

They have a great selection of coffee and pastries, but you are going to be paying a lot. $18 for 2 lattes. Not worth the price, but DC prices.

Favorite part was sitting outside on the steps and doing some good ole fashion people watching.

I’d go here if you don’t care to break the bank and want to people watch as you sip your coffee.

Great breakfast!  We loved the eggs Benedict and avocado toast. We also liked dinner. We tried the salmon, which was okay, but nothing special, and the baked chicken breast, which was delicious and came with amazing mashed potatoes.

Overall I thought it was good. Had the pot pie, French onion soup, and the Mac and cheese. I say the food is good because if it were to have a touch of garlic powder, a hint of rosemary, or some fresh cracked pepper, it would shift to great. It was by no stretch of the imagination bad, it was good with small room for improvement. I’ll still be back.

The service was great. The waitress was very attentive. The manager came to the table and asked how things were. To me that is perfection. It shows they are committed to the customer experience. I really appreciated that.

The dress code was casual. It was nice to see people just there relaxing and having a good time.

I will certainly be back.

We arrived at opening and were only customers until closer to noon. The staff are the best. One at our party even reached out about a job opportunity to a waitress.

I ordered the duct confit croquettes. Very good and perfect size. Another ordered the Apple Parker House Rolls. I believe this may be the best bread I have ever eaten.

Others ordered French Onion and Kale Salad. She enjoyed both. Another had the Cuban. I went with Halibut Sandwich. The fish was cooked perfectly.

If in DC again I would go back.

This was my second time dining at Lincoln. I love the ambience and overall look of the restaurant. Service was attentive and courteous. I ordered the macaroni and cheese and French onion soup as starters and the pan roasted salmon as my entree. The macaroni and cheese is amazing, as it was the last time I was there. The French onion soup also delicious. I was a little disappointed in my salmon. I am a lover of salmon and order it as often as I can, but I found the salmon and accompanying brussels sprouts to be lacking seasoning. Overall, I would dine here again, and I look forward to my next time.
Such a great eatery spot, the food, service and atmosphere was amazing. I would have liked our mimosas to be stronger but it was tasty. The devil eggs and fried green tomatoes were my absolute fave.

I was pleasantly surprised by this outstanding dining experience. So happy to have found this gem.  The food and menu surpassed our expectations.  We had to come back later for to go desserts.  The restaurant decor is so interesting, amazing artwork, and fascinating murals of pennies.  The staff was great.  I highly recommend a visit and I look forward to my return.

Nice restaurant in D.C.. The cocktails and the calamari was a really good way to start. I had the shrimp scampi and it was delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and definitely a must try. My friends enjoyed their entrées as well. I love the feel of the restaurant. Nice lighting and interior with a nice bar as well. The service was nice and efficient. Highly recommend this place.

Clyde's was on point as usual. I got there around 11:30 on a Sunday morning and by the time I left an hour later the restaurant was packed (the bar had the World Cup final on TV). Great food and an awesome cocktail made my lunch amazing. I got a grilled chicken sandwich and the A-Pear-ently It's Fall drink. Jasmine, my server, also brought a small wedge of warm crumb cake. Delicious!! First floor has a bar and dining area, but the second floor is where everything happens. Another bar, tons of booths and tables, and there's even an indoor patio area. Jasmine was the best, she took very good care of me and made sure I had everything I needed. Check out Clyde's for a casual, laid back dining experience.

I have come to Clyde's every time I come to DC and decided to have my birthday brunch here today.  It didn't disappoint. The service staff was attentive and polite.  I opened with mussels and had the lump crab cake as an entree.  Both were gorgeous and delicious. I finished with a blackberry shortcake.  Highly recommended.

We went around 11pm on a Thursday. It was crowded. We went too late to be seated by a hostess but we were allowed to sit at a booth in the bar area. We ordered food from the late night menu. The crab and artichoke dip was just right. It wasn’t oily. The chili was delicious with the sour cream and cheese. The crab Cake was tasty. We would go back again.

We were from out of town and decided to catch a hockey game. Unfortunately it didn't occur to us that finding a place to eat before the game would be so hard. We walked into Clydes and it was mobbed. At least an hour wait and we had 2 young children. However the manager on duty saw our struggle and managed to seat us right away. Amazing customer service and I'd give 5 stars just for that!

Food was delicious and service was top notch. Go here.

Superb food and an experience to remember from the moment we entered the restaurant. It was a birthday celebration and there were so many unique experiences. The beer menu is extensive. I had a cherry beer which was sweet but not too sweet. For appetizer, I had the beet salad. The beets melted in your mouth. I had the duck for the main course and it tasted like filet mignon with a crisp fatty edge. The wait staff was the best. We loved Amber.
Such a great meal!  The duck was so delicious. We also had amazing oysters. The most exciting was the huge selection of Belgium beer. So fun to try so many!

Great place for Belgian beer and mussels and frites. There are four types of mussels on the menu and the frites come with three different Mayo based dipping sauces.

They also sometimes have happy hours specific to certain beer companies. And they know a lot about beer. Nice that it's open now since it was closed for the pandemic. They have a really large patio without outdoor seating.

Sit at their outside patio or inside, Brasserie Beck has been a staple for mussels and Belgian cuisine for years. The beer list reads like a short novel and shouldn’t be missed. We ate here recently for the first time in years and the food (mussels, burger and frites, and chilled beers) was all solid, though perhaps a bit below its pre-pandemic levels. Service was exceptional.

The place is large and spacious, the kitchen is in the middle and visible , the atmosphere is very nice and relaxed . Food taste great and portions are really generous.
A beer menu that looks endless and full of great choices .
We’ve been here on two different evenings.
Onion soup, charcuterie, burgers, moules au vin blanc, truffled ham sandwich everything was delicious nicely presented and worth it.
The owner and the staff always prompt kind and professional are the cherry on top of this business.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!  My work company had our holiday lunch gathering here recently!  The restaurant has a nice and fancy vibe, and surprisingly was packed for a weekday lunch.  Their salad bar is awesome—with a huge selection of choices.  Their meats (that come around your table) is so delicious and well flavored.  In addition, staff is very friendly and attentive.  I was a little disappointed that they didn’t have the chocolate cake as a dessert option for our meal, but the cheesecake with strawberry sauce was really good!

This place is such a gem in DC. I came here at lunch time at 3 Jan 23 with my family. There are many choice of fresh salad and side dish. Their steak are so perfect. we have had a wonderful time here. Moreover, the price is so affordable. I wish I could come back here again. Finally, the service here is the best. Especially Ms.Sally the woman server. She’s so nice and has full service mind.
I rate this restaurant 5/5.

We went for our anniversary and had an amazing time. I left a note in my reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary and they sat us in a secluded spot on a balcony meant for couples. The servers were kind and not too overbearing. The system they have, where you flip a card to yes to be served food and no for no food, is genius. At the very end our desert plate included "happy anniversary" written out in melted marshmallow. Beautiful decor and overall a lovely experience. My partner says that all food pales in comparison to what is served here, and it is definitely true!

We celebrated my daughter’s birthday here and the service was excellent! They give attention and ask if you need anything but they don’t overdo it. The salad bar, fejioada,   the meats, were all superb! Serving of the meat was fast. We can’t say enough of good praise for the staff who served us. They gave my daughter molten chocolate cake with ice cream which made her so happy. They made our celebration extra special. 5/5

Came on Sunday evening for dinner, packed as always. Glad we went early before 5 PM. Service was attentive. Cocktail was delicious well stocked salad bar. Meets were tasty like always.
Parking garage is conveniently located right next-door to the restaurant, there are also additional garage parking on street parking is all around.
Walking distance to parks, national Christmas tree, and main DC attractions . Highly recommend.

Went here for one of my many birthday dinners. As a new vegetarian this place definitely had a menu with me in mind. I was stuffed when I left. We had the menu with five courses and enjoyed every single one of them. Amazing. Would definitely go again, don’t know the price because i didn’t pay.  😇

Overall it was a great dining experience. The restaurant wasn't overly loud and it had an intimate vibe. We felt secluded enough in our table. The service was a bit slow to start, we waited over 20 min just to get our drink orders in. But then it picked up and we got our 5 course sampler and it was great. Some of the best food I've had.

We came for restaurant week and it was a great deal! Loved the plant based options. We had to wait 15 min for our table after we arrived on time for our reservation but it was worth it once we were seated. The mushroom dish was delicious and the portions for all courses were huge. Definitely ended the meal full and satisfied.

This place has been on my must try restaurants list forever, and finally made it on my birthday. We tried the five course meal. While each dish was carefully thought through and well presented, I think the beet salad didn’t really work (it was bitter) and grilled eggplant was a bit bland. Though I don’t typically enjoy mushrooms as much, I was blown by the Hen of mushrooms dish, and absolute winner. Overall, I would recommend this place!

I was there for a celebration and had a wonderful time and a wonderful meal. My appetizer was shrimp & grits. The main course was a filet. Desert was a yummy molasses cake with ice cream. It was all so delicious!!
